data.title: Crash when any script is closed
data.body:
Godot 3.0 9575dbdf788e8a5154b3ec2f66913e731ac02850
Windows 10 64 bits

Godot crashes when I close a script, either with File->close menu or Ctrl+W.
Interestingly, it doesn't crash when it's a documentation file.

Error in the console right when it happens:
```
ERROR: RID_Owner<struct VisualServerCanvas::Item>::getornull: Condition ' !id_map.has(p_rid.get_data()) ' is true. returned: 0
   At: d:\projets\info\godot\engine\godot_fork\core\rid.h:164
ERROR: VisualServerCanvas::canvas_item_set_visible: Condition ' !canvas_item ' is true.
   At: servers\visual\visual_server_canvas.cpp:331
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29337224-df2b876a-8210-11e7-81f1-f7f318c83391.png)

data.title: KinematicBody2D::Move doesn't detect certain collisions
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Windows 10, Godot Steam (2.1?)
- Haven't tested version 3.0

**Issue description:** I am moving a KinematicBody2D towards another collision body. The collision body has a complex and dense polygon shape inside. When you use KinematicBody2D::move near a dense number of polygon vertices, the KinematicBody2D does not register a collision _but_ it get's immediately shoved outside of the other body.

<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
**Expected:** KinematicBody2D will move (from within another polygon2d) and if pushed back register a collision.
**Actual:** KinematicBody2D gets wildly thrown somewhere and does not register a collision.

**Steps to reproduce:**
_Probably better to just skip to the project._
1.  Create a kinematic character you will move around 
2.  Create a collision body (_any_) and give it a collision polygon which has as many polygon fragments as you can fit in
3. Add code to move around for your character
4. If there was a collision in your move, revert it, temporarily ignore and move again (yes through the obstacle )
5. If there was not a collision, compare the distance travelled to the vector used for move. If it is vastly different, you've found the glitch.

_Notes:_ This happens in areas I believe with vertices that 2 or 3 or more polygons connect to in a shape.


**Link to minimal example project:**[gd_bug_example.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1226287/gd_bug_example.zip)

This project will demonstrate it best. There will be instructional labels. 
**enable visible collision shapes**

data.title: [Questions 2.2] Main Loop iterations and Physics
data.body:
Hello!

I'm trying to make some fancy stuff with genetic algorithm. Basically I have a scene that creates 12 SceneTrees and initiate the same given PackedScene in it. These 12 simulations are iterated by the main scene using the MainLoop's iteration function.

I do that in order to be able to speed up or slow down at will the simulations. Sadly, it seems that the physics aren't affected by this. For example, if I speed every 8 times, things handled by my scripts will be sped up 8 times, but an object falling due to gravity is going to move the exact same way instead of moving 8 time faster.

I could micro manage this by increase by 8 the gravity. But this feels bad.

Is there a way to do what I want to do? Am I using MainLoop properly? Is there separate physics server with different paces for each scene trees?

Thanks!

data.body:
~~Re-fixes #10071~~ but with a comment as @akien-mga suggested.

__EDIT:__ Sorry, there wasn't actually a build error; my local repo failed to sync properly. At least I'll take the chance to add the comment. :)

data.title: Ability to translate and scale 3D nodes on two axes at once, locking the remaining axis
data.body:
In Blender, it is possible to translate and scale 3D nodes on two axes at once (XY, YZ, or XZ) while locking the remaining axis (it is done by holding <kbd>Shift</kbd> while pressing an axis modifier key). This makes it easier and quicker to move or scale 3D geometry along a flat surface, for example.

Supporting this in Godot would make the 3D workflow more convenient.

data.title: Commented rows do not respect text indent when inserting a new line below them.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows - Godot 2+

**Issue description:**
There is an annoying usability issue in the code editor:

```
func example():
	var answer = 42
#	var foobar = make_foobar()
	var baz = foobar.baz
```

Imagine that the caret is located at the end of the commented line.

Now, create a new line, and the caret jumps back to the very beginning of the new line - which is quite impractical and annoying.

So, I'd suggest to make the caret respect the previous row's indent - whether the row is commented out or not.

data.title: Applying scale to a spatial turns it upside down
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, 53c23b02226968d27e6caadcb801343697ac4fe9

**Issue description:**
When we apply scale to the model that is looking in z positive direction, in a result it will be turned upside down: 
![upside_down](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/29320233-d4692308-81d6-11e7-82ff-7e582057638e.gif)

I did bisection and I found that 53c23b02226968d27e6caadcb801343697ac4fe9 introduced this behavior 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download reproduction project.
2. Open `res://Issues/YFlipIssue/YFlipIssue.tscn`
3. Run it.

Alternatively create new spatial and add this code as it's script:
```
func _ready():
	look_at(global_transform.origin + Vector3(0,0,1), Vector3(0,1,0));

func _process(delta):
	var lscale = get_scale();
	set_scale(lscale)
```

**Link to minimal example project:**
[upsidedown_issue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1225347/upsidedown_issue.zip)

data.title: ClassDB: Provide the enum name of integer constants
data.body:
- `BIND_CONSTANT` can only be used with constants of anonymous enums or constant variables.
- `BIND_ENUM_CONSTANT` is used for constants of named enums.

The API is:
- `get_integer_constant_enum(class, constant)`, `get_enum_list(class, out enums)` and `get_enum_constants(class, enum, out constants)` for ClassDB.
- `get_global_constant_enum(index)` for global constants.

The name of the enums is `enum.Class::Enum`, or `enum.Enum` for global enums.

To check if a type is an enum:

``` C++
if (type == Variant::INT && type_name.begins_with("enum."))
```

Then you just split the name to get the class and enum name.

data.title: move_and_slide() "sensitivity"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master


**Issue description:**
I'm trying to get into the KinematicBody2D API and just realized that move() and move_and_slide() behave very differently, when used with the same values. In the simple example project, using move() the body moves pretty fast whereas with move_and_slide() it hardly moves at all. For move_and_slide() this means, that i would need very high speed values (10000+) to get an appropriate movement speed, which seems kind of odd. Is this normal behavior or is there something wrong with the "sensitivity" of the move_and_slide() function?

**Steps to reproduce:**
![slide](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/29315181-11680be4-81c2-11e7-9a57-fa3c32c03b86.gif)

```
extends Node2D

var direction = Vector2(0,0)
const SPEED = 1000
onready var player1 = $player1
onready var player2 = $player2


func _fixed_process(delta):
	direction.x = Input.is_action_pressed("ui_right") - Input.is_action_pressed("ui_left")
	player1.move_and_slide(direction * delta * SPEED)
	player2.move(direction * delta * SPEED)

```
**Link to minimal example project:**
[move_slide.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1224945/move_slide.tar.gz)

data.title: Console floods with error when changing scenes with a omni light with shadows enabled
data.body:
**Linux Ubuntu 16.04 LTS  - Godot alpha 1:**


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
If you have a scene with a Omni light that has shadows enabled the console floods with these two errors:
```
Condition '!id_map.has(p_rid.get_data()) ' is true. returned: __null
Condition '!sli' is true. Continuing..:
```
The error continues endlessly prints when you return to the scene.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene with a Omni light that is casting a shadow and change scenes. Then change back to the original scene.


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[Example_Project.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1223870/Example_Project.zip)

Edit: changed point light to Omni light in both the title and description. (Got Godot's and Unity's light names mixed up  )

data.title: Use precision for samples only when #version 300 es
[Godot 3.0alpha1] Inspector pane shows empty when run scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

PC with Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Godot 3.0 alpha1

**Issue description:**

When I run a project or scene, the Inspector pane gets empty and I can't change any properties of the selected node. This issue can't be reproduced with Godot 2.1.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create a scene with some nodes.
2. Ensure a node (any node) is selected, and its properties shows in the Inspector pane.
3. Run the scene using any method (F5, F6 or Ctrl+Shift+F5, there's no difference).

The game window appears but you can see that the Inspector pane in the Godot editor becomes empty even with a node selected in the Scene pane.

You need to click in a node again (in the Scene pane) to fill the Inspector pane with its properties.

![2017-08-14-192313_1280x1024_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/616169/29283442-0113f140-8127-11e7-90cd-dde945d81c95.png)

Removed unnecessary assignments

data.title: Rename Light2D::scale to texture_scale, so it doesn't conflict
remove redundant type hints from couple bindings
data.body: Couple days ago I learned that type hints should not be used when creating bindings from c++. I took a look at my recent prs, I think some (most?) bindings were already corrected but I have also found couple redundant ones.

data.title: Enable command-line export
data.body:
The syntax is identical to what it was in 2.1, but now you specify
preset name instead of platform name.

data.title: Use include/exclude export filters. Fixes #9860
Implemented borderless window functions on OS X
data.body: Just ported the code I've added a while ago to the 3.0 branch.

data.title: Fix StreamPeer put_utf8_string not working
data.body:
`StreamPeer::put_utf8_string` was using the string length instead of the char array size when writing.
This caused read to break (and subsequent read on that buffer to break too).

EDIT: See demo: 
[buffer_utf8_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1222119/buffer_utf8_test.zip)

data.title: Fix console warning: Condition !env is true
data.body:
The trivial yet astute fix was suggested by @bojidar-bg in IRC.
Compiling confirms it does the job, so thought I'd push a PR.

data.title: Vertex shader failed to compile [AMD, Windows 10, Regression from #9b9a723]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 (AMD FirePro D300); master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/9575dbdf788e8a5154b3ec2f66913e731ac02850

**Issue description:**
Displays nothing but a white screen and following errors:
```
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: Shader Compiler	Type: Error	ID: 2000	Severity: High	Message: glCompileShader failed to compile a GLSL shader with the following shader info log: 'Vertex shader failed to compile with the following errors:
ERROR: 22:1: error(#228) Type should be float or int
ERROR: 23:1: error(#228) Type should be float or int
ERROR: 24:1: error(#228) Type should be float or int
ERROR: error(#273) 3 compilation errors.  No code generated
At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:122
...
```

Default precision qualifiers for samplers (added in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/9b9a723c771a0146cb16e23c3dac744af312bad7) only allowed in GLSL 4.40+, and Godot shaders are `#version 330`.

Replacing version with `#version 440` or removing `precision highp sampler*` lines fixes the problem, looks like AMD driver has too strict GLSL validation.

[GLSL 3.30 spec](https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.3.30.pdf#page=49)
[GLSL 4.40 spec](https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.40.pdf#page=95)

data.title: Fix console warning: Condition !env is true
data.body:
The trivial yet astute fix was suggested by @bojidar-bg in IRC.
Compiling confirms it does the job, so thought I'd push a PR.

data.title: Endless error messages apparently caused by playing an .ogg file as a sound effect
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux 17.04 64bit
Godot master branch pull 9575dbd.

**Issue description:**
Initially, I'd been having issues where imported non-looping .ogg files used as sound effects would stop looping .ogg files from playing. So I'd attempted to recreate something to use to demonstrate this issue.

That *seems* to have been fixed. *However*, what happens with this is that:
1 - Music plays. A timer is set, when it times out it plays a .wav sound effect, then is restarted.
2 - When the timer times out the second time it plays a .ogg sound effect.

At 2 is when the debugger tab fills up with endless "0:00:24:0077 - Condition '!active' is true." error messages.

"ERROR: _mix_internal: Condition ' !active ' is true.
   At: modules/stb_vorbis/audio_stream_ogg_vorbis.cpp:38." appears on the terminal.

**Steps to reproduce:**
See attached.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[10330_Demonstrator.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1221993/10330_Demonstrator.zip)
